details.flavorText: A charau-ka warrior carries hatchets, daggers, and similar weaponry on their person and usually doesn’t worry about running out of thrown weapons when rocks plucked from the ground are just as deadly in their hands.

description.value: Trigger The charau-ka’s turn begins. Frequency once per hour; Effect The charau-ka is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} until the end of its turn, and can use the extra action to Stride or Strike. While in the frenzy, the charau-ka can’t speak and automatically critically fails Stealth checks, due to its loud wailing.

Any weapon a charau-ka throws gains the deadly d6 weapon trait. Furthermore, when a charau-ka throws an improvised weapon, it does not take the –2 penalty for doing so, nor does it take a penalty for using a thrown improvised weapon with the nonlethal trait to make a lethal attack.
